subject: Law
title: Legal Positivism
description: A quick, practical guide to Legal Positivism.

hook.text: Is a morally terrible law still a law? Legal positivists say yesâ€”law is whatever the system produces.

buildup.text: Legal positivism holds that law is a set of rules created by human institutions, separate from morality.

discovery.text: John Austin said law is the command of a sovereign backed by sanctions. H.L.A. Hart refined it as a rule system.

twist.text: Hart's 'rule of recognition' explains how we identify valid laws: not by their content, but by their source.

climax.text: After the Holocaust, critics asked: can positivism justify obeying unjust laws? The debate reshaped legal philosophy.

punchline.text: Law is law, positivists say. Whether you should obey it is a different question.

quiz.question: What does legal positivism claim about law and morality?
